text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

65 million people are
globally displaced,

71% of them living below the
poverty line, 85% of them
in developing countries.

This creates a lot of pressure
on fragile job markets,

creating a race to the bottom
for low-end jobs, increasing
poverty across the board.

Dignify breaks the
cycle of poverty

by connecting both refugees and
poor locals in host countries
to outsourced digital work.

On one hand, we
work with companies

worldwide to secure digital
work that can be done remotely.

On the other, we work with
organizations on the ground

to recruit both refugees
and locals to do that work.

We are a freelance platform
that matches skills and tasks,

providing the displaced and
refugees an opportunity to use
their skills to access income.
And now is the time for Dignify.

First, people are more
connected than ever.

90% of urban refugees
have 3G access.

Second, the digital freelance
market is booming: $25 billion
expected by 2022.

We're also ready
to go to market.

We have partners in Uganda,
Jordan, and Lebanon.

We have 12 letters of
intent from clients
willing to outsource work.

And in our first pilot, 11
refugees doubled their income.

Help us prove that the way
out of the refugee crisis

is by giving people
an opportunity to be
part of the global economy.
Come dignify the world with us.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
